en:
Search knowledge lets users access articles, guides, and/or blogs relevant to a particular topic, or issue that the user is searching for, without having to use separate search engines. 

This field shows how the Assistant responds to situations and employee's questions.

This section lets you control how the assistant responds to unsupported user commands, by redirecting them to relevant articles.

For detailed help, see <<link>>., or email <support@kore.com>>
Assistant's response applicable to 'Search Knowledge' flow
Name of the intent to show articles
Changing the Intent name affects how the name is displayed in the chat window.
Changing the Intent name affects how the name is displayed in the chat window.
Assistant's prompt seeking for the article name that needs to be searched
Assistant's response with the list of articles found

Available variables to construct the message

Field1: top_article_title, Example Value: Excel troubleshooting
Field2: top_article_snippet, Example Value: Excel files can exist on the computer for a long time. They are upgraded from version to version, and frequently travel from one user to another user. Frequently, a user inherits an Excel file but doesn't know what is included in the file. The following things can cause performance or crashing issues
Field3: delay_n, Example Value: delay_3
There would be a delay of 'n' seconds after this message on adding this variable

Field3: delay_n, Example Value: delay_3
There would be a delay of 'n' seconds after this message on adding this variable
Assistant's response when there are no articles to show
